thread.title: 24 British Drinking Quirks That Brits Don't Realise Are Weird
thread.title_full: 24 British Drinking Quirks That Brits Don't Realise Are Weird

author: Tabatha Leggett
title: 24 British Drinking Quirks That Brits Don't Realise Are Weird
text:
Brits have mastered the art of using the round system to their advantage, but everyone else just finds it a bit stressful. ID: 10739592 8. Using squash as a mixer to make a vodka cocktail View this image ›
Twitter: @hannahtheant This is the drink of choice for any British uni student.
ID: 10739823 9. Genuinely enjoying a shandy when it’s hot outside View this image ›
Twitter: @LadySileL Mixing lager with lemonade is the perfect way to drink for ages without getting wasted immediately. But if you’re not British, you probably find the idea kinda gross.
ID: 10739578 10. Drinking pint sized pints at the pub and then not eating dinner View this image ›
Twitter: @ruthjoyceart The rest of the world drinks pints that are actually like 2/3 of a pint before going out for dinner. We stay in the pub until last orders and get chips on the way home.
ID: 10739588 11. Your first experience of alcohol being Caribbean Twist, Apple Sourz, or Malibu Twitter: @jacquie_anne_
Twitter: @jacquie_anne_
Twitter: @NicoleLynnAmes
 If it wasn’t sweet enough to rot your teeth, it wasn’t sweet enough for you.
ID: 10741532 12. Getting drunk in horrible pubs before you were 18 to avoid being ID’d View this image ›
E4 For some reason, sitting at a sticky table where you were surrounded by old men was a very glamorous thing to do between the ages of 16 and 17.
ID: 10739649 13. Being legally allowed to drink at 18, and still only drinking alcopops View this image ›
Twitter: @CSimmss213 You were all about that WKD and VK life.
ID: 10739848 14. Cheeky Vimtos in general View this image ›
Twitter: @JamesSaintLatic Mixing port with a WKD to make a Cheeky Vimto is a rite of passage for every teenage Brit. To the rest of the world, it’s just revolting.
ID: 10739584 15. Not questioning it when someone around you orders a Guinness and black or a Snakebite View this image ›
Twitter: @DalePLawson 100% acceptable to most British people, 100% gross anywhere else.
ID: 10739817 16. Buying mini Proseccos to take on picnics in the summer View this image ›
Twitter: @kstrauss11 There’s nothing wrong with a teeny tiny bottle of Prosecco with a screw top lid.
ID: 10739623 17. Drinking Pimm’s the moment it gets vaguely sunny outside View this image ›
Twitter: @sociable_sam Everyone has one friend who chops up the cucumber, strawberries, and mint in advance of the picnic and brings it in a Tupperware container.
ID: 10739669 18. And ordering mulled wine in a pub the moment it gets cold again View this image ›
Twitter: @Wainwright_Pub You don’t even necessarily like it, it’s just something you have to do when it starts to feel wintery.
ID: 10739806 19. Cider in general View this image ›
Twitter: @FreyaMCrawshaw To us, it’s the perfect summer’s day drink, but to everyone else it’s just a bit sickly.
ID: 10739576 20. Deboxing boxed wine and sneaking it into Leeds or Reading festival View this image ›
Twitter: @bkearney81 If you didn’t celebrate the end of our GCSEs with a bladder of wine in a muddy field, are you even British?
ID: 10739671 21. Feeling really classy when you first drink Lambrini or Echo Falls Twitter: @echo_falls
Twitter: @echo_falls
 And then cringing when you think back to your teenage years.
ID: 10741595 22. Being really really into gin View this image ›
Etsy Every Brit knows at least five people whose Twitter bio says “gin-lover”. Any why on earth not? Gin is great.
ID: 10739855 23. Strawpedoing Smirnoff Ices View this image ›
Twitter: @MattCPFC Every Brit knows that in order to down something fizzy successfully, you need a straw sticking out of the side for the gas to escape through.
ID: 10739642 24. And finally: Being ashamed and proud of how much you drink in equal measure View this image ›
brandonflowersfakeassteeth.tumblr.com Staggering your recycling after Christmas because you don’t want the bin man to see how much booze you’ve been drinking = the most English thing ever. Boasting about how much booze you drank over Christmas to the bin man = also the most English thing ever.
ID: 10741677 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
Tabatha Leggett is head of buzz at BuzzFeed UK and is based in London.
